intro: Sturmia wageneri, commonly known as the waxflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its showy, waxy, pink or white petals. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Sturmia wageneri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
